First let me inform you about a very important thing to those buyers who are complaining that they haven't received the earphone, please check the box properly, the earphone is just below where the USB cable was kept.
  

  Now coming to the phone, which I purchased for just 10,800  (in 12 months zero cost EMI with my HDFC credit card) by exchanging my 1.5 years old Moto X style at 12,000 . Thanks flipkart and oppo for this great deal!
  

  This phone is definitely overpriced, and if it's priced between 15-20k then it's really a good buy!
  

  I'm using this phone since last 4 days, and here's positive and negative impressions:
  

  Camera: The rear 16mp camera is really great. It captures some great shots in daylight, indoor light and low light. You'll get great bokeh effect because of it's 1.7f aperture. The flash is bright too.
  

  The front 16mp selfie camera is one of the best I've ever seen. It captures great details and bright selfies at all lighting conditions. The 8mp wide angle lens is very wide for group selfies the quality is quite good. Though it lacks details and in low light it attracts noise. But I'm not impressed with it's bokeh mode. First, the bokeh mode works in beauty mode only which makes the photo artificial and second it's not able to differentiate properly between the subject and background. As a result you'll see your hair, shoulders are getting blurred. Oppo needs to update the camera app so that we can take the advantage of the dual selfie camera properly. So basically it's a phone with two front camera not dual camera.
  

  Build quality and design: The build quality is good because of metal body. Special thanks to oppo for providing good soft transparent cover and pre applied screen guard out of the box.
  

  Performance: The performance is really smooth because of SD652 and 4gb ram. I haven't find any hiccups while doing daily task of browsing, social networking, camera, gaming etc. I've also noticed that the os use very less RAM in comparison to with other phones. Take example of my Mi A1 where the total ram is 3.5gb and in this phone the total ram is around 3.8 gb. But one big flaw in this color os is the ram management. The os often freeze the apps which run in background like internet speed meter, Ad blocker etc. As a result I miss the notification of whatsapp, Facebook etc. I'm still trying to find a way to resolve this.
  

  Display: The corning gorilla glass 5 protected 6 inch is very bright and colourful. But it's highly saturated too. The display os on the warmer side and unfortunately you can't change the color temperature. Due to this the skin tone of people while watching videos looks red, yellow and pinkish.
  

  Sound: The sound quality is nice. Speaker volume is adequately loud. The real HD sound equalizer by oppo didn't excited me much. Dolby atmos and my Mi A1 sound output is much better. The earphone is decent, nothing special.
  

  Call: The call quality is good and the network reception is also fine with my Jio 4g.
  

  Finger print: The finger print sensor is one of the fastest. But personally I prefer finger print on rear side. Due to the size of the phone it's bit difficult to unlock it with your thumb everytime.
  

  OS and software: I didn't liked the color OS at all. It's really far behind MiUi. There's not much customization  option you'll get. Wish they improve it with update and hope I'll get nougat update.
  

  Battery: I'm yet to test the 4000mah battery properly, will add my feedback after a week or two. But I'm really impressed with the fast VOOC charging which is blazingly fast. It charges the phone from 15 to 90 in just an hour and fully charged the phone in approx 90 minutes.
  

  Overall I'm very much satisfied with my 10,800  spent on this selfie expert. I've never thought or planned that I'll ever use oppo smartphones, but seriously guys if you're getting such huge discount deals, and okay with some flaws which I've mentioned above  then go for it! I'm sure you'll not regret it.
 
 

   READ MORE

Good camera centric phone. Even lthough I am not happy with the pricing, the phone is a good performer in terms of camera, battery life, call  and data, media.
  

  The build quality of this phone is good and looks like a member of iPhone family. The full HD screen is vibrant and the colours appears to be over saturated. There is no option in the phone to set the colour balance. Viewing angles of the screen are great and also the outdoor visibility is good too.
  

  There is no lag in the phone's daily performance. Memory management implementation is good thanks to the 4 GB RAM. Call quality is loud and clear even with volte.
  

  Camera performance is good in both indoor and outdoor lighting conditions but the OIS implementation is above average only. If you are not careful you will end up with shaky images.
  

  Battery life is okay and it can easily last for a full day with moderate usage.
  

  The phone is good for multimedia. Audio from headphone sounds great with real HD option turned on. It even sound better than Lenovo vibe X3.
  

  Now about the cons I observed in the phone. Many people especially those who have used Samsung or Nexus phone would not appreciate the experience of color os. The phone's price never justifies it's hardware. Offline models like vivo V5 plus (having almost similar specs) are sold for a much cheaper price. Future software updates are a big question mark. The phone launched in 2017 still run on the almost outdated marshmallow os.
  

  Overall it a good phone. I'll recommend this phone over Samsung Galaxy A and C series phone.

Oppo f3 plus
  

  Advantages:
  
  Screen display quality is awesome. Rich feeling.
  

  You can change display font by using third party app (ifont). But in f3 you don't have that option.
  

  Battery backup is good. Awesome fast charging.
  

  FAST finger print sensor. Working very nice.
  
  Camera picture quality is good.
  

  Color os operating system is really designed well. It gives rich feeling while using the phone.
  

  Third party launchers are working fine with this phone. (N launcher, nova launcher, etc).
  

  Notification settings are nice.
  

  Inbuilt app security lock is nice (finger print app lock and passcode lock)
  

  Battery backup in standby mode is awesome.
  

  Music player sound effect is good (maybe depends on headphone quality).
  

  Phone looks very good when handling and very slim.
  

  Disadvantages:
  

  Phone relased before more than six months but still running in marshmallow.
  

  Color os 3.2 released in oppo f5 but it still running in 3.0
  

  Phone is getting heat While using camera for more than 5 minutes.
  

  No NFC Connectivity in this highly priced  phone.
  

  Audio output is low in outdoors and indoors. Only hearable at night (while others sleeping)
  

  Gorilla glass 5 but I got a small scratch on my display even i maintained well. Don't know what is the use of Gorilla 5 glass.
  

  And its 2.5d curved display is irritating when the tempered glass is not fit in to the display. But without tempered glass phone looks awesome but i don't want to take risk.
  

  Conclusion:
  
  You can buy this phone if the manufacturer gives proper software updates regularly at least up to Oreo ( because of high price). Otherwise its a very very Awesome phone in the market..

The complete smartphone package.
  
  I am using this phone since 1 week and i liked it very much. I always used big brand products and i was thinking whether  to buy it or not but i like specification on paper a lot and with good exchange value i buy this phone.
  
  Now come to point
  
  1.Design it slim and superb looking phn jst like i phn i fall in love with this beuty after i saw it. P
  
  2.Processor is very fast doesnt heat even at high uses while charging also, power managment to good in this processor very good at long day uses.
  
  3.Screen it is large 6" screen but phn size is nt uncomfortable it is easy to hold for boy atleast,  even though it is tft display it gives u very superior quality of visuals from any angle ppi is very good here for sharo images
  
  4.Camera now come to tag line for this phn sual selfie  camera so not to mention both camera has a good ability to capture good images. You dont need selfie stick any more with his wide angle secondry front camera,  to my suprice rear camera is too good at tgis price and they didnt even advertise about it belive me its better thn front camera and they didnt even mentioned it.
  
  5.Battery as per my thinking i was confused about 4000mah battery for large 6" display and how long it wiil last but they manage it so well even  after heavy uses like surfing, downloading, wathching movies it last all day. I dindt play games so sorry dnt nw abt tht hw lng it wil last with heavy games.  But for decent user it far more than enough.
  
  6.charger if u ask me charger is best thing i like in this mobile it charge my phn upto 50% in just  30 minutes or less may be i liked it very much nw i dont need to carry power bank just beacause i forget to charge my phn. Now with this charger in very shrt time i will get day long charged phn loving it. Its vooc 4amp 5v charger.
  
  7.Os louncher- its colour Os it was little dificult for me to adjust to this os beacause i never had any chinese phn before but i liked this simple, fast and responsive doest take ram for unworthy stuff like animation widgets and blah blah blah.... It gives u what u need nothing unecessory adede to it keeps phn simple and lag free
  
  8.Music Chip-they didnt even tell us what they used vuts it best music i heard so far with this phn and its headphones its superb feels like uvr living in the musin mesmorising.
  
  So i dont see any flaws with this phn ya but price tag of 25000 makes you reconsider but you got nice exchange offer so it wil be good around 20,000 and to my notice its farrrrrrrr better thn vivo v7+ in every angle. So buy it.

Overall Mobile is Good.
  

  1. Actually, this mobile is not worth for 25K (as shown in flipkart), but I bought this mobile for ~15K on exchange offer (25K - (8000 exchange off + 700 for my 5 years old Moto G mobile + 1600 HDFC card discount) = ~15K).
  
  2. The front camera is Very Good, frankly speaking, my face is oiled face, but the selfy comes like a fresh face. So, selfy lovers can go for this mobile. Quick focus and quick shoot.
  
  3. Back came is also good, but not like the front camera. Quick focus and quick shoot.
  
  4. Sometimes, I felt slowness (but not hanging) while normal operations. Not major
  
  5. The fingerprint is very slow, previously I was using "LeEco Le 1S", in that Fingerprint is very quick. but in Oppo F3 Plus, I have to hold and wait for .5 to 1 second. This is annoying everytime.
  
  6. 6inch screen is very big (previously I was using 5.5inch mobile), initially I felt very big, but its ok now (no other way. :-) ). We have to use both the hands for typing.
  

  If you are normal user (not Game player) and selfy lover, just go for it.

Review after one week  of usage... First of all thanks to flipkart  for the fabulous exchange offer... 6000 off and 8000 exchange bonus... Bought the phone for 12.5k on exchange of my 1.5 year old Samsung J7.
  

  PROS
  
  6 inch colourful screen is a pleasure to watch videos....
  
  5000 Mah battery  lasts up-to 2days on moderate  usage...
  
  Amazing picture quality especially  for front camera.... Back camera is good Too
  
  No difficulty  in migrating from my Samsung  (using since 2013) since both have a lot similarity
  
  Finger print ID is very agile and handy...
  
  Sound quality  is fine ...
  
  Even though  it is using the older generation Snapdragon 653  processor it not getting hang can navigate  easily  between apps...
  
  Build quality  is good...
  
  Dual sim and expandable memory are other plus points
  
  Feels like iPhone in certain aspects.
  
  Comes with free screen guard and back cover...
  
  CONS
  
  Could  have used the latest 835 Snapdragon
  
  Especially  when you consider that it's priced around 30 and competors  like one plus 3T are using latest Snapdragon....
  

  OVERALL
  
  happy  with my buy especially in wake of the exchange offer... Which is still continuing in flipkart......

I got this one at 16000 approx under exchange and bank offer. I exchange Lenovo K3 note by which i got extra 5000 discount + phone value + 1500 bank discount. It is amazing experience for me.
  

  Now about the phone:-
  

  Best feature of this phone is its VOOC Charging technology. Phone can charge around 80% in 35 minutes.
  

  Secondly dual fromt camera which is amazing in day and night shots. It is specially designed for group selfies. Rear camera is also at satisfactory level.
  

  Processing speed is good as it comes with 1.96 ghz octa core processor with 4gb ram.
  

  The main issue i am facing is its software. It is still running on android marshmallow 6.0 whereas all other smartphones in this range are already powerd by android 7.1.1 and ready for android 8 too. I have gone through my research and find out that Oppo have no plans to release software update in coming months which is big disadvantage. Oppo is not good at all on software updates.
  

  Screen size is huge and cannot use single handed. I think it is more comfortable if it is 5.5. However, you can use it by one hand by compressing the screen. Resolution, screen colors are good and seems natural.

This is not an average phone but it is much bigger than than a 5.5 inch one. However, the screen to body ratio is 75% and above and hence a large portion of the front face is covered with screen. The weight is also good at 185gms.  the battery life is really good and for me lasts more than a day with routine use and minor gaming. I do not use 3g or 4g on the phone as the SIM card is ordinary 2g one. Inuse WiFi on it almost full day. A transparent silicon cover  is provided in the box. It fits vey snugly and looks good too. No to some pros and cons
  

  Pros
  
  Great screen. Display is crisp and vibrant. It also has blue light filter option. Touchscreen is good and responsive. Doesn't feel flimsy and overall phone build is awesome.
  
  Battery life is really good. Vooc charging is awesome.
  
  Down firing speaker is quite loud to make phone calls and for music or movies
  
  Weight and form factor is really good.
  
  Cameras are good too. But I did not find them truly awesome. Also, I don't do a lot of photography with mobile
  
  Provided head phones are good. They produce decent sound for voice and music
  

  Cons
  
  Charging with ordinary charger is slow. Vooc charger is big in size. So carrying it might not be possible for all
  
  All rocker buttons should have been on one side of the phone. That is volume key should be above power key. It's difficult to use volume keys. Also, the software for volume should provide a slider to adjust volume for phone, music, alarm etc...no such slider provided
  
  The touch buttons at bottom of screen bleed white light, so it looks kind of cheap.
  

  Overall a great phone. Flipkart provided fantastic exchange offer. The person who came for delivery was patient and polite and worked through the exchange process calmly with us. Thank you Flipkart for that.
  

  Ps: I knew before purchasing that the phone might not get latest android updates. I do miss features that are provided in android 7, but this is an informed decision I took. So not taking away credit from the phone itself

The selection of this phone was purely coincidental but I'm glad this happened. I was sort of looking for a replacement for my one plus x because it kept running out of space and was struggling with my use for power.
  

  The sale at Flipkart bought me a good deal on this phone. Though technically I should have gone for the one plus 3t due to obvious reason but the deal tilted the scales in favor of this one.
  

  Every aspect of this phone is top notch. The only glitch I feel is the Android version and the pricing. I hope the Android version will be upgraded soon and I hope OPPO doesn't decide to sell this phone at super discounts in the next few months. I also wished the screen was quad HD.
  

  Color OS is good but peculiar and you have to put efforts liking it. Eventually you might get there because it is not at all bad.
  

  The build quality is very good and so is the battery life. I hope the processor is good for couple of years and OPPO works on the Android update. The phone is very comfortable to hold but smaller hands might struggle.
  

  They copied everything from iPhone but didn't bother to include the hardware DND button. Even the one plus family has one now so this could have been included.
  

  I might not recommend buying this since the price can offer more popular options but I can very well say that you won't regret buying it either.
 
 

   READ MORE

CONS:
  
  1. Sound Quality is below Average even when compare to Asus Zenfone 2.
  
  2. The Camera functions are not much user Manageable - All are default Menu Driven.
  
  3. The Latest Color OS (UI) is below Average - Personal Customisation not at all Possible (I wish to include Wifi Hotspot in Notifcation slider. But not possible).
  
  4. No Android / OS Update for a model Launched just Six Months Back with Old Android Version (Marshmallow)
  
  5.  No App drawer (Even Huawei included this faclity in latest UI)
  
  6. No Double Tap to Sleep option as in Asus (to Avoid prolonged use of Power Button). Only Double tap to Wake is there which is not much useful since it has Front FP Scanner
  
  7. No Dual App support.
  

  GOOD THINGS (Not Pros)
  
  1. Basis Mobile Functions are good
  
  2. No Heating even on Fast charging  (provided for this mobile).
  
  3. Both Cameras good but no Major customisation.
  

  The Pricing is too much for the above specs (only worth for Rs.12k.
  

  Oppo should provide atleast Nougat update for the money they robbed from us for this mobile.

  The irony is that i exchanged iphone 6s plus for this phone - i don't like iphone closed system.
  
  Anyways this was a gift to my father and he liked it (he is only familiar with android so i didnt want to gift him ios). The screen is big. Battery is awesome. Even after good use of music and YouTube app,  battery was down to only 70% in one day.
  
  Music sound is good - they claim to have some hardware audio chip for better audio - It is better or equal to my s8+.

column6: Nice one to have with great features and accessories
column7:
Got this on 31th Oct. happy to say that flipkart is delivered it before time.
  
  Device is far better then others I had used earlier. and my experience with this from last 13-14 days is awesome.
  
  A must buy piece from Oppo.
  
  So here are some feedback for Oppo F3 Plus
  

  Pros:
  
  Powerful Selfie camera
  
  Color OS with  nice features and having feel of iOS foe few of it's functionality
  
  Touch is good
  
  Body structure Strong
  
  Thanks for Pre-Installed Screen Guard - good quality
  
  Special Thanks for Nice Earphones  - good quality
  
  Also the Transparent back cover  - good quality
  
  No heating Issue
  
  Battery performance is up to the mark one one time charge need in 1 and half day with few calls and full day data use
  
  and out of all I got it in best price for my Leveno K3 note Exchange and other offer by flipkart and HDFC
  

  Cons
  
  Few features missing in OS ( Must have some profile management for different hours of working, lunch and home Mobile Ring mode settings)
  
  Sound quality can be more better ( it is good right now)
  


  ---------------------------------------------------
  
  Overall awesome deal
  

  Thanks :)

  4] Little bit over priced. It would have the price 16k.
  
  .

  If ur a camera / photo lover buy this phone without any hesitation.

column6: Good for selfies and pics, average on performance
column7:
I have used this phone for 3 weeks and here is the review for product. This phone is good for those who love taking selfies and photos on the go. Using on ideal basis, the phone performs decent without any issues. The picture quality of the camera is in great. One of the best feature of front camera is that it has a wide view mode which covers at-least 50 more area than  normal camera. On a normal use basis, the battery gives 1 day backup. I have not checked for gaming performance since I am not a big fan of gaming activity. The color OS is not so great but you will get used to it once you starting using. Below is the Cons and Pros for the product:
  

  Cons:
  
  -Not an AMOLED display
  
  -Color OS not so impressive
  
  -Battery backup just for a day
  



  Pros:
  
  -Wide view front Camera
  
  -Impressive Beauty mode camera
  
  -64 GB in built memory with 4 GB of RAM
  
  -Dedicated slot each for 2 Sims and 1 memory card
  
  -Fast fingerprint response
  
  -Great external speaker quality, doesn't distort when on high volume.
  
  -Transparent back-cover and screengaurd, ejector pin & earphone included.
 
 

   READ MORE

I have bought this mobile by exchanging my old Lenovo A6000 plus, for  14999. I am very happy with flipkart exchange offer. Very quickly delivered by FK. I have some issue with the mobile. Then I claimed for the replacement. Flipkart accepted my request and gave me another OPPO F3. I would like to share my experience with my OPPO F3 after 3months,
  
  Pros: 1.Great selfie camera and good rear camera
  
  2. Fast finger print scanner
  
  3.Fast charging and long lasting battery backup are very good
  
  4. Very nice phone on this price range we can go for.
  
  5.No heating issues even after long time game plays of heavy games
  

  Cons:
  
  1. Photos taken on low light is not up to the mark, very blur photos even the selfie cam.
  
  2. Overall performance is good, but the available RAM is only 2.1 GB on starting the mobile. In most of the cases available RAM is only 1.5GB even there is no background apps are running. This is the only backlog with this mobile. Even my friend's 3GB ram mobile has its 2.3 gb available ram on start.

Pros :
  
  1- Awesome camera. One of the best
  
  2- 64gb memory with 128 expandable. Commendable at this price
  
  3- 4gb ram and octa core processor makes the experience smooth and lightening fast. I ran 21 apps simultaeneously and still no lag..so you can imagine
  
  4- Speaker at bottom instead of back side which makes the playback very loud and clear
  
  5- No matter how much load i put on it, no heating at all.
  
  6- Battery quite good.
  
  7- Network reception above par.
  
  8- Gorilla glass. Also screen clarity is quite good for a non full HD phone.
  

  Cons:
  
  1- Even though Cool OS UI is good, I shifted MiUi and feel quite restricted with customization and features. Hope frequent updates will be coming and improve the features.
  
  2- Pixel density 267 ppi which shows as some backgrounds are a bit granulated if you compare it with 440+ ppi screens of samsung or  Mi phones. But still not that noticeable to casual eyes.

Reviewing after 2 months of usage:
  
  Pros
  
  1. Looks superb
  
  2. Sim tray with 2 nano sim slot+ sd card slot....best about this phone
  
  3. Screen is undoubtedly good
  
  4. Fingerprint scanner works superb
  
  5. No hanging whatsoever
  
  6. Battery backup is good for a 3075 mAh battery...works full day with a single charge
  
  7. Camera. Needless to say about it. Oppo first sells it camera than the phone. Front (16MP) is beter than rear(13MP)
  

  Cons
  
  1. Android 5.1.... For a price this range OS could have been upgraded
  
  2. User interface....its very basic, little or no customisation at all.
  
  3. Color OS.....nothing but copy of iOS....till looks it is okay to copy apple....but OS also
  
  4.  Led notification light is just a waste of space. Doesnt turn on while charging...and notifications also only half the time

  Pros

  3. Color OS.....nothing but copy of iOS....till looks it is okay to copy apple....but OS also

Pros :
  
  1- Awesome camera. One of the best
  
  2- 64gb memory with 128 expandable. Commendable at this price
  
  3- 4gb ram and octa core processor makes the experience smooth and lightening fast. I ran 21 apps simultaeneously and still no lag..so you can imagine
  
  4- Speaker at bottom instead of back side which makes the playback very loud and clear
  
  5- No matter how much load i put on it, no heating at all.
  
  6- Battery quite good.
  
  7- Network reception above par.
  
  8- Gorilla glass. Also screen clarity is quite good for a non full HD phone.
  

  Cons:
  
  1- Even though Cool OS UI is good, I shifted MiUi and feel quite restricted with customization and features. Hope frequent updates will be coming and improve the features.
  
  2- Pixel density 267 ppi which shows as some backgrounds are a bit granulated if you compare it with 440+ ppi screens of samsung or  Mi phones. But still not that noticeable to casual eyes.

Reviewing after 2 months of usage:
  
  Pros
  
  1. Looks superb
  
  2. Sim tray with 2 nano sim slot+ sd card slot....best about this phone
  
  3. Screen is undoubtedly good
  
  4. Fingerprint scanner works superb
  
  5. No hanging whatsoever
  
  6. Battery backup is good for a 3075 mAh battery...works full day with a single charge
  
  7. Camera. Needless to say about it. Oppo first sells it camera than the phone. Front (16MP) is beter than rear(13MP)
  

  Cons
  
  1. Android 5.1.... For a price this range OS could have been upgraded
  
  2. User interface....its very basic, little or no customisation at all.
  
  3. Color OS.....nothing but copy of iOS....till looks it is okay to copy apple....but OS also
  
  4.  Led notification light is just a waste of space. Doesnt turn on while charging...and notifications also only half the time

I Purchased for 13,500/ with Exchange of (A7000 Lenovo)
  

  Got mobile on Tuesday May 2nd Packing is fine and Mobile Box is very attractive you will have a Handset (Temped glass + Back cover it's not good),Adapter,USB cable,Headset and user manual.
  

  The mobile is very handy and light weighted
  
  Camera is good, picture quality is too good in day and moon light (Pri - 13 MP & Sec - 16 MP)
  
  Device performance is good as it has 4 GB RAM you wont fine any lag
  
  Inbuilt  ROM is 64 GB (54 GB usable) no need of SD card
  
  You can Encrypt (lock) all app's using finger print
  
  You will have a notification LED on left top it's nice (White colour)
  
  Booting time is faster and it won't ask Pattern when you restart your device
  
  Device will restart when you are removing tray (4G sim + 4G sim + Micro card 128 GB) 3 in 1
  
  Finger print sensor is awesome it's lightning fast
  
  You can control music player even the mobile is locked,Double tap to awake device
  
  Headset and USB port are good & Sound quality is good on speakers
  
  Call quality is too good you can hear the opponent clearly without any noise
  
  Charging speed is good (90 Mins to 100% form 10%)
  
  You can change the system font, Inbuilt office (Word,Excel) is there no need an external app
  
  Notification bar GUI is looks good with that the screen backgroud looks nice
  
  Battery is capable for a day when mobile data & Wi-Fi are turned on (without internet usage it may last long upto 1.5 days)
  
  It wont support 1080 p videos
  
  After 10% of charge it's draining fast with in 15 mins if your watching videos

Build quality and hardware is nice. However software wise I did not find Oppo mobiles up to the mark. Even in high end phones like F1s they are still using Android 5.1 (Lollipop). On contacting Oppo they say that an upgrade to Marshmallow will be rolled out soon but they have not decided a specific date and time (this was before 3 months and there is still no sign of update).
  

  Only massive hardware doesn't serve the purpose. A good and latest software is required to keep up with the hardware.
  

  I would not suggest to buy Oppo and Vivo phones. This is my last Oppo phone and I am not buying these Chinese brands henceforth.

Its been almost 6 month since I bought Oppo F1s.
  
  Its a very good camera phone. Photos from both front and rear camera are gorgeous. Beautify mode really works awesome.
  
  Average battery life. Gets through the day for moderate usage.
  
  Now the fun begins. Having massive 4 GB RAM is not enough. Poor memory management considering its price tag. OS is very heavy. Not customizable at all.
  
  And god that very poor processor. Feels like I'm in 2013, holding a basic samsung phone. It doesn't justify the price. Never buy this phone except for camera. Only camera.
  
  And last but not least, the OS. Still running on Android 5.0 when android 8.0 is announced and will be released soon. Oppo announced its upgrade from lollipop to marshmallow in first week of May, 2017. Four and half months later also, we don't have any news about the update. Never ever buy Oppo phone. I made a huge mistake! God bless Oppo.

First let me inform you about a very important thing to those buyers who are complaining that they haven't received the earphone, please check the box properly, the earphone is just below where the USB cable was kept.
  

  Now coming to the phone, which I purchased for just 10,800  (in 12 months zero cost EMI with my HDFC credit card) by exchanging my 1.5 years old Moto X style at 12,000 . Thanks flipkart and oppo for this great deal!
  

  This phone is definitely overpriced, and if it's priced between 15-20k then it's really a good buy!
  

  I'm using this phone since last 4 days, and here's positive and negative impressions:
  

  Camera: The rear 16mp camera is really great. It captures some great shots in daylight, indoor light and low light. You'll get great bokeh effect because of it's 1.7f aperture. The flash is bright too.
  

  The front 16mp selfie camera is one of the best I've ever seen. It captures great details and bright selfies at all lighting conditions. The 8mp wide angle lens is very wide for group selfies the quality is quite good. Though it lacks details and in low light it attracts noise. But I'm not impressed with it's bokeh mode. First, the bokeh mode works in beauty mode only which makes the photo artificial and second it's not able to differentiate properly between the subject and background. As a result you'll see your hair, shoulders are getting blurred. Oppo needs to update the camera app so that we can take the advantage of the dual selfie camera properly. So basically it's a phone with two front camera not dual camera.
  

  Build quality and design: The build quality is good because of metal body. Special thanks to oppo for providing good soft transparent cover and pre applied screen guard out of the box.
  

  Performance: The performance is really smooth because of SD652 and 4gb ram. I haven't find any hiccups while doing daily task of browsing, social networking, camera, gaming etc. I've also noticed that the os use very less RAM in comparison to with other phones. Take example of my Mi A1 where the total ram is 3.5gb and in this phone the total ram is around 3.8 gb. But one big flaw in this color os is the ram management. The os often freeze the apps which run in background like internet speed meter, Ad blocker etc. As a result I miss the notification of whatsapp, Facebook etc. I'm still trying to find a way to resolve this.
  

  Display: The corning gorilla glass 5 protected 6 inch is very bright and colourful. But it's highly saturated too. The display os on the warmer side and unfortunately you can't change the color temperature. Due to this the skin tone of people while watching videos looks red, yellow and pinkish.
  

  Sound: The sound quality is nice. Speaker volume is adequately loud. The real HD sound equalizer by oppo didn't excited me much. Dolby atmos and my Mi A1 sound output is much better. The earphone is decent, nothing special.
  

  Call: The call quality is good and the network reception is also fine with my Jio 4g.
  

  Finger print: The finger print sensor is one of the fastest. But personally I prefer finger print on rear side. Due to the size of the phone it's bit difficult to unlock it with your thumb everytime.
  

  OS and software: I didn't liked the color OS at all. It's really far behind MiUi. There's not much customization  option you'll get. Wish they improve it with update and hope I'll get nougat update.
  

  Battery: I'm yet to test the 4000mah battery properly, will add my feedback after a week or two. But I'm really impressed with the fast VOOC charging which is blazingly fast. It charges the phone from 15 to 90 in just an hour and fully charged the phone in approx 90 minutes.
  

  Overall I'm very much satisfied with my 10,800  spent on this selfie expert. I've never thought or planned that I'll ever use oppo smartphones, but seriously guys if you're getting such huge discount deals, and okay with some flaws which I've mentioned above  then go for it! I'm sure you'll not regret it.

Good camera centric phone. Even lthough I am not happy with the pricing, the phone is a good performer in terms of camera, battery life, call  and data, media.
  

  The build quality of this phone is good and looks like a member of iPhone family. The full HD screen is vibrant and the colours appears to be over saturated. There is no option in the phone to set the colour balance. Viewing angles of the screen are great and also the outdoor visibility is good too.
  

  There is no lag in the phone's daily performance. Memory management implementation is good thanks to the 4 GB RAM. Call quality is loud and clear even with volte.
  

  Camera performance is good in both indoor and outdoor lighting conditions but the OIS implementation is above average only. If you are not careful you will end up with shaky images.
  

  Battery life is okay and it can easily last for a full day with moderate usage.
  

  The phone is good for multimedia. Audio from headphone sounds great with real HD option turned on. It even sound better than Lenovo vibe X3.
  

  Now about the cons I observed in the phone. Many people especially those who have used Samsung or Nexus phone would not appreciate the experience of color os. The phone's price never justifies it's hardware. Offline models like vivo V5 plus (having almost similar specs) are sold for a much cheaper price. Future software updates are a big question mark. The phone launched in 2017 still run on the almost outdated marshmallow os.
  

  Overall it a good phone. I'll recommend this phone over Samsung Galaxy A and C series phone.

Oppo f3 plus
  

  Advantages:
  
  Screen display quality is awesome. Rich feeling.
  

  You can change display font by using third party app (ifont). But in f3 you don't have that option.
  

  Battery backup is good. Awesome fast charging.
  

  FAST finger print sensor. Working very nice.
  
  Camera picture quality is good.
  

  Color os operating system is really designed well. It gives rich feeling while using the phone.
  

  Third party launchers are working fine with this phone. (N launcher, nova launcher, etc).
  

  Notification settings are nice.
  

  Inbuilt app security lock is nice (finger print app lock and passcode lock)
  

  Battery backup in standby mode is awesome.
  

  Music player sound effect is good (maybe depends on headphone quality).
  

  Phone looks very good when handling and very slim.
  

  Disadvantages:
  

  Phone relased before more than six months but still running in marshmallow.
  

  Color os 3.2 released in oppo f5 but it still running in 3.0
  

  Phone is getting heat While using camera for more than 5 minutes.
  

  No NFC Connectivity in this highly priced  phone.
  

  Audio output is low in outdoors and indoors. Only hearable at night (while others sleeping)
  

  Gorilla glass 5 but I got a small scratch on my display even i maintained well. Don't know what is the use of Gorilla 5 glass.
  

  And its 2.5d curved display is irritating when the tempered glass is not fit in to the display. But without tempered glass phone looks awesome but i don't want to take risk.
  

  Conclusion:
  
  You can buy this phone if the manufacturer gives proper software updates regularly at least up to Oreo ( because of high price). Otherwise its a very very Awesome phone in the market..

Overall Mobile is Good.
  

  1. Actually, this mobile is not worth for 25K (as shown in flipkart), but I bought this mobile for ~15K on exchange offer (25K - (8000 exchange off + 700 for my 5 years old Moto G mobile + 1600 HDFC card discount) = ~15K).
  
  2. The front camera is Very Good, frankly speaking, my face is oiled face, but the selfy comes like a fresh face. So, selfy lovers can go for this mobile. Quick focus and quick shoot.
  
  3. Back came is also good, but not like the front camera. Quick focus and quick shoot.
  
  4. Sometimes, I felt slowness (but not hanging) while normal operations. Not major
  
  5. The fingerprint is very slow, previously I was using "LeEco Le 1S", in that Fingerprint is very quick. but in Oppo F3 Plus, I have to hold and wait for .5 to 1 second. This is annoying everytime.
  
  6. 6inch screen is very big (previously I was using 5.5inch mobile), initially I felt very big, but its ok now (no other way. :-) ). We have to use both the hands for typing.
  

  If you are normal user (not Game player) and selfy lover, just go for it.

Review after one week  of usage... First of all thanks to flipkart  for the fabulous exchange offer... 6000 off and 8000 exchange bonus... Bought the phone for 12.5k on exchange of my 1.5 year old Samsung J7.
  

  PROS
  
  6 inch colourful screen is a pleasure to watch videos....
  
  5000 Mah battery  lasts up-to 2days on moderate  usage...
  
  Amazing picture quality especially  for front camera.... Back camera is good Too
  
  No difficulty  in migrating from my Samsung  (using since 2013) since both have a lot similarity
  
  Finger print ID is very agile and handy...
  
  Sound quality  is fine ...
  
  Even though  it is using the older generation Snapdragon 653  processor it not getting hang can navigate  easily  between apps...
  
  Build quality  is good...
  
  Dual sim and expandable memory are other plus points
  
  Feels like iPhone in certain aspects.
  
  Comes with free screen guard and back cover...
  
  CONS
  
  Could  have used the latest 835 Snapdragon
  
  Especially  when you consider that it's priced around 30 and competors  like one plus 3T are using latest Snapdragon....
  

  OVERALL
  
  happy  with my buy especially in wake of the exchange offer... Which is still continuing in flipkart......

This is the best phone in this class but not the best. Price is very high compare to its specifications. It was available for 24990 whent I bought this. Thanks to Flipkart sale. I got this one at 16000 approx under exchange and bank offer. I exchange Lenovo K3 note by which i got extra 5000 discount + phone value + 1500 bank discount. It is amazing experience for me.
  

  Now about the phone:-
  

  Best feature of this phone is its VOOC Charging technology. Phone can charge around 80% in 35 minutes.
  

  Secondly dual fromt camera which is amazing in day and night shots. It is specially designed for group selfies. Rear camera is also at satisfactory level.
  

  Processing speed is good as it comes with 1.96 ghz octa core processor with 4gb ram.
  

  The main issue i am facing is its software. It is still running on android marshmallow 6.0 whereas all other smartphones in this range are already powerd by android 7.1.1 and ready for android 8 too. I have gone through my research and find out that Oppo have no plans to release software update in coming months which is big disadvantage. Oppo is not good at all on software updates.
  

  Screen size is huge and cannot use single handed. I think it is more comfortable if it is 5.5. However, you can use it by one hand by compressing the screen. Resolution, screen colors are good and seems natural.

Reviving after two days of usage
  

  Bad ones about the phone
  

  1) This phone still runs on Android M,  color os 3.0. With oppo f5 being already out,  not sure when or if this phone gets android N or O updates.
  

  2) Screen looks very saturated, everything looks darker in color than usual.
  

  3) This phone is  overpriced, you get same set of features in Xiaomi at 16k-17k. Processor could have been snapdragon 835 in order to justify this huge price.
  

  4) Color OS UI is still very much novice,  need a lot of improvements. It is least of all the UI's.
  



  Good ones about the phone.
  

  1) Phone size is huge also very sleek, looks premium at hands
  

  2) Cameras,   both rear and front gives you very detailed and awesome pics.  Better than average expectations.
  

  3) Comes with 4A fast charger,charges 10% in 5 mins, 90% in 1h 10 mins,  and 100% in 1.5 hours.
  

  4) Fingerprint sensor is quicker
  

  5) Comes with tempered glass applied and transparent silicon case, good quality earphones provided. You dont have to spill extra 1000 bucks for these.
  


  Verdict::
  

  If you are looking to flaunt your premium phone and a camera philic guy, without worrying too much on UI and software updates. Go for it.

This is not an average phone but it is much bigger than than a 5.5 inch one. However, the screen to body ratio is 75% and above and hence a large portion of the front face is covered with screen. The weight is also good at 185gms.  the battery life is really good and for me lasts more than a day with routine use and minor gaming. I do not use 3g or 4g on the phone as the SIM card is ordinary 2g one. Inuse WiFi on it almost full day. A transparent silicon cover  is provided in the box. It fits vey snugly and looks good too. No to some pros and cons
  

  Pros
  
  Great screen. Display is crisp and vibrant. It also has blue light filter option. Touchscreen is good and responsive. Doesn't feel flimsy and overall phone build is awesome.
  
  Battery life is really good. Vooc charging is awesome.
  
  Down firing speaker is quite loud to make phone calls and for music or movies
  
  Weight and form factor is really good.
  
  Cameras are good too. But I did not find them truly awesome. Also, I don't do a lot of photography with mobile
  
  Provided head phones are good. They produce decent sound for voice and music
  

  Cons
  
  Charging with ordinary charger is slow. Vooc charger is big in size. So carrying it might not be possible for all
  
  All rocker buttons should have been on one side of the phone. That is volume key should be above power key. It's difficult to use volume keys. Also, the software for volume should provide a slider to adjust volume for phone, music, alarm etc...no such slider provided
  
  The touch buttons at bottom of screen bleed white light, so it looks kind of cheap.
  

  Overall a great phone. Flipkart provided fantastic exchange offer. The person who came for delivery was patient and polite and worked through the exchange process calmly with us. Thank you Flipkart for that.
  

  Ps: I knew before purchasing that the phone might not get latest android updates. I do miss features that are provided in android 7, but this is an informed decision I took. So not taking away credit from the phone itself

  So overall good buy in this segment, a value for your hard earned money.

column6: All Oppo phones - not a worthy phone.
column7:
Hi All,
  
  Have bought OppoA37 on 4th Aug which was launched a week back.
  
  Every website will talk about the prons and will not talk about the issues with the phone, even retailers. Here is what you should know before you make you decision.
  

  Cons:
  
  1) Apps can't move to SD card, which means you will have only 2GB space to use or download any applications. (This is like medieval age phone feature). You will not be able to use 16GB ROM space for your applications. Hence give a serious through about any Oppo phone. I have checked this features for all Oppo serious by visiting Oppo store.
  

  The funny thing was: Not a single counter sales man (even Oppo exclusive stores) was aware about this issue.
  
  2) UI: Although it looks good, but have many operational issues while handling the phone.
  
  a) Multi-touch action is not good: You can't delete multiple messages, Contact at a time. You need to inside every message/contact and then delete them individually.
  

  2) Phone gets heats up, even if I am on call for more than 25-30 min.
  
  3) Battery is decent, don't expect to last for more than a day. It can just last for max a day.
  
  4) Camera is decent. Not bad.
  
  5) Earphones are against not up to the standard. You may need to buy a one for better sound.
  

  Pros:
  
  1) Apple look alike phone, so you will feel good feeling while carrying this phone.
  
  2) Display is of good quality, premium looking
  
  3) Looks tough phone (too early to say anything on this, but this so far my experience)
  
  4) Camera is decent, don't expect too much from it. The pics get blurred the moment you zoom the pictures.
  

  To summarize - It's a big "NO" for any OPPO phones. Because:
  
  1) You will have limited space 2GB - 3GB for your App, which is too less in today technology. It's like you are going back 7-8 years in terms of technology.
  
  2) You will have many options at this price (Xiaomi Note 3 and series are very good phone - Just go for it).
  

  Yes: Only because of look and feel of the product.
 
 

   READ MORE

column6: Good selfie camera but not so amazing screen.
column7:
I purchased 2 sets for my family. Everything about this phone was almost good until I purchased Micromax evok note(I purchase mobile for all the family members of my huge family).
  
  After comparing both below is my observation:
  

  Pros:
  
  Selfie camera(16MP)
  
  Smooth touch.
  
  Got it at a discounted price at 13,583. Good service by flipkart.
  
  Good looks specially if we don't use cover.
  
  Supports VR due to gyroscope.
  

  Cons:
  
  Screen is a dull, so it's not a fun to use and to watch videos. At this price, at least full hd screen should be there. Biggest drawback.
  
  Need to charge it before the day ends. Battery is 2900 mAH.
  
  Overpriced. May be due to 16MP front camera.
  

  Suggestion: Best for selfie lovers not for mobile lovers.

Selfie centric phone.
  
  With a 6 days of use im writing this review.
  
  I preordered this device on 9th may and on 13th [its release day] i hot the mobile.
  
  But they didnt give bahubali case when i contact them they have given 150/- wallet.but i got selfie stick which is nice.
  

  Pros:
  
  1] 16 + 8 mp camera. Exellent . [GIF, ULTRA HD, EXPERT MODE]  
  
  2] back camera 13mp is very nice and no shutter lag. [GIF, ULTRA HD, EXPERT MODE]
  
  3] 5.5FHD display.
  
  4] Super fast finger print scanner. [0.2seconds]
  
  5] 51.5GB usable ROM
  
  6] Full charging within 2 hours.
  
  7] 12 hours battery back up for heavy user. If we dont use Net it has last for 1 & 1/2 day.
  
  8] VOLTE support with clear voice.
  
  9] super autobrightness screen and eye protection also.
  
  10] light weight and slim model easy to handle.
  

  Cons.
  
  1] Video options are not there like slow motion . Only 720p and 1080p for both cameras.
  
  2] while charging phone heating observed.
  
  3] in 4GB RAM it is showing only 1.95GB RAM available .

column6: Good for selfies and pics, average on performance
column7:
I have used this phone for 3 weeks and here is the review for product. This phone is good for those who love taking selfies and photos on the go. Using on ideal basis, the phone performs decent without any issues. The picture quality of the camera is in great. One of the best feature of front camera is that it has a wide view mode which covers at-least 50 more area than  normal camera. On a normal use basis, the battery gives 1 day backup. I have not checked for gaming performance since I am not a big fan of gaming activity. The color OS is not so great but you will get used to it once you starting using. Below is the Cons and Pros for the product:
  

  Cons:
  
  -Not an AMOLED display
  
  -Color OS not so impressive
  
  -Battery backup just for a day
  



  Pros:
  
  -Wide view front Camera
  
  -Impressive Beauty mode camera
  
  -64 GB in built memory with 4 GB of RAM
  
  -Dedicated slot each for 2 Sims and 1 memory card
  
  -Fast fingerprint response
  
  -Great external speaker quality, doesn't distort when on high volume.
  
  -Transparent back-cover and screengaurd, ejector pin & earphone included.
 
 

   READ MORE

Then I claimed for the replacement. Flipkart accepted my request and gave me another OPPO F3. I would like to share my experience with my OPPO F3 after 3months,
  
  Pros: 1.Great selfie camera and good rear camera
  
  2. Fast finger print scanner
  
  3.Fast charging and long lasting battery backup are very good
  
  4. Very nice phone on this price range we can go for.
  
  5.No heating issues even after long time game plays of heavy games
  

  Cons:
  
  1. Photos taken on low light is not up to the mark, very blur photos even the selfie cam.
  
  2. Overall performance is good, but the available RAM is only 2.1 GB on starting the mobile. In most of the cases available RAM is only 1.5GB even there is no background apps are running. This is the only backlog with this mobile. Even my friend's 3GB ram mobile has its 2.3 gb available ram on start.

column6: All Oppo phones - not a worthy phone.
column7:
Hi All,
  
  Have bought OppoA37 on 4th Aug which was launched a week back.
  
  Every website will talk about the prons and will not talk about the issues with the phone, even retailers. Here is what you should know before you make you decision.
  

  Cons:
  
  1) Apps can't move to SD card, which means you will have only 2GB space to use or download any applications. (This is like medieval age phone feature). You will not be able to use 16GB ROM space for your applications. Hence give a serious through about any Oppo phone. I have checked this features for all Oppo serious by visiting Oppo store.
  

  The funny thing was: Not a single counter sales man (even Oppo exclusive stores) was aware about this issue.
  
  2) UI: Although it looks good, but have many operational issues while handling the phone.
  
  a) Multi-touch action is not good: You can't delete multiple messages, Contact at a time. You need to inside every message/contact and then delete them individually.
  

  2) Phone gets heats up, even if I am on call for more than 25-30 min.
  
  3) Battery is decent, don't expect to last for more than a day. It can just last for max a day.
  
  4) Camera is decent. Not bad.
  
  5) Earphones are against not up to the standard. You may need to buy a one for better sound.
  

  Pros:
  
  1) Apple look alike phone, so you will feel good feeling while carrying this phone.
  
  2) Display is of good quality, premium looking
  
  3) Looks tough phone (too early to say anything on this, but this so far my experience)
  
  4) Camera is decent, don't expect too much from it. The pics get blurred the moment you zoom the pictures.
  

  To summarize - It's a big "NO" for any OPPO phones. Because:
  
  1) You will have limited space 2GB - 3GB for your App, which is too less in today technology. It's like you are going back 7-8 years in terms of technology.
  
  2) You will have many options at this price (Xiaomi Note 3 and series are very good phone - Just go for it).
  

  Yes: Only because of look and feel of the product.
 
 

   READ MORE

column6: It is a very good phone. (an one month usage review)
column7:
Well, to start, I didn't buy it from Flipkart as I've always preferred a physical store to buy electronics. I'm going to highlight the pros and cons after one month of usage. Before I write, I just want to mention some hard facts about review. Nowadays, almost everyone boasts of being a smartphone expert and the reviews they write are becoming increasingly bizarre and conflicting. Going through the negative reviews against this phone in this site, I found that almost all of them are just as useless and bizarre.
  
  Pros:
  
  1. Without much technological babble and theory about what being a good display and what should be a good screen and display properties, the display of this phone is very good. Yes, it is not in the same line as display of premium phones, but in the group of HD display, this display is very good and clearly visible in strong sunlight.
  
  2. Has two capacitive soft keys,not noticeable in daylight, but a soft white color that glows softly in dark.
  
  3. Has one notification LED, which is white and the glow is soft. I find it aesthetically pleasing.
  
  4. The fingerprint sensor is as it should be. Touch and unlock. It's like that. My human brain can't differentiate the tiniest lag, if any, there is in this phone while unlocking with fingerprint.
  
  5. Has a good security feature of encrypted apps. One can easily go in the settings and assign the apps with extra level of security such that when anyone will try to access that app, say whatsapp, it will ask for a pattern unlock and this pattern will be different than the pattern to unlock the phone. That is, if anyone sets a unlock pattern to unlock the phone, he can set a different pattern for these encrypted and private apps.
  
  6. There is a separate setting for designating private areas. One can set photos, videos and apps in that area and thus, making the private things safe from prying eyes. Those photos, videos or apps will not show in the phone unless explicitly viewed in the security settings with a separate unlocking pattern if set.
  
  7. I use one JIO SIM for the last two weeks, and to say truly, the result is just what is advertised by JIO makers. That is the internet speed is perfect . There is absolutely no buffering on YouTube or Dailymotion for 1080p videos.
  
  8. The video calling and voice calling features are at par with standards set and the volume on the earpiece is loud enough to hear in noisy places.
  
  9. I'm not into gaming, so can't really comment on the performance of the phone on that, but there are absolutely no heating issues to be concerned of.
  
  10. The camera is good. Please don't be concerned with someone commenting on high contrast or saturation levels in the pictures clicked by the phone or issues about not getting the full 13 or 16 megapixels from the camera. The pictures are good enough to get a good print. Although, I must say a little grain is there when pictures clicked in very low light. In medium to low light scenarios, the grains are barely noticeable and will look good in the computer screen. I cast the pictures on my 43 inch 4K TV and it looks good enough. Moreover, everybody uses one or two photo editing apps nowadays and so minor blemishes can easily be fixed. I suggest Google's Snapseed. Another thing I will like to mention to those people who are saying that they are not getting full megapixel effects in their pictures, should know that the phone makers always mention the full megapixel of their cameras subject to one condition. Most people don't know that the full megapixel in pictures can be achieved ONLY in the 4:3 aspect ratio of the pictures. If one clicks pictures with full screen mode, i.e. 16:9, the megapixels WILL always be lower.
  
  11. The phone doesn't show any lag and the app switching is smooth as butter with one left soft key dedicated for the task.
  
  12. The speaker is very good with two speaker grills at the bottom delivering stereo sounds loud enough for the purpose.
  
  13. The charging is efficient and though it doesn't say anywhere of being capable of quick charge, the charging time is decent.
  
  14. There's a power saver mode which is very effective.
  
  15. A lot of themes and fonts are available to customize the phone OS looks.
  
  16. The build quality is good and the back looks premium.
  
  17. I got a factory administered screen guard on the phone which is a little sticky on the front but at least,regular cleaning still makes it clinging to the screen with zero air bubble. Also, a transparent back cover has been provided which till date is just fine.
  
  18. Gesture controls are a draw.
  
  Cons:
  
  1. The absence of app drawer is frustrating. The default icons being on the larger size looks cluttered.
  
  2. The default music player is not good and for that I will suggest a good music player app to be downloaded from GP.
  
  3. Doesn't run Marshmallow. So forget about Nougat for now.
  
  4. The charging adapter unit is bulky.
  
  I suggest to go for this phone.
 
 

   READ MORE

column6: It is a very good phone. (an one month usage review)
column7:
Well, to start, I didn't buy it from Flipkart as I've always preferred a physical store to buy electronics. I'm going to highlight the pros and cons after one month of usage. Before I write, I just want to mention some hard facts about review. Nowadays, almost everyone boasts of being a smartphone expert and the reviews they write are becoming increasingly bizarre and conflicting. Going through the negative reviews against this phone in this site, I found that almost all of them are just as useless and bizarre.
  
  Pros:
  
  1. Without much technological babble and theory about what being a good display and what should be a good screen and display properties, the display of this phone is very good. Yes, it is not in the same line as display of premium phones, but in the group of HD display, this display is very good and clearly visible in strong sunlight.
  
  2. Has two capacitive soft keys,not noticeable in daylight, but a soft white color that glows softly in dark.
  
  3. Has one notification LED, which is white and the glow is soft. I find it aesthetically pleasing.
  
  4. The fingerprint sensor is as it should be. Touch and unlock. It's like that. My human brain can't differentiate the tiniest lag, if any, there is in this phone while unlocking with fingerprint.
  
  5. Has a good security feature of encrypted apps. One can easily go in the settings and assign the apps with extra level of security such that when anyone will try to access that app, say whatsapp, it will ask for a pattern unlock and this pattern will be different than the pattern to unlock the phone. That is, if anyone sets a unlock pattern to unlock the phone, he can set a different pattern for these encrypted and private apps.
  
  6. There is a separate setting for designating private areas. One can set photos, videos and apps in that area and thus, making the private things safe from prying eyes. Those photos, videos or apps will not show in the phone unless explicitly viewed in the security settings with a separate unlocking pattern if set.
  
  7. I use one JIO SIM for the last two weeks, and to say truly, the result is just what is advertised by JIO makers. That is the internet speed is perfect . There is absolutely no buffering on YouTube or Dailymotion for 1080p videos.
  
  8. The video calling and voice calling features are at par with standards set and the volume on the earpiece is loud enough to hear in noisy places.
  
  9. I'm not into gaming, so can't really comment on the performance of the phone on that, but there are absolutely no heating issues to be concerned of.
  
  10. The camera is good. Please don't be concerned with someone commenting on high contrast or saturation levels in the pictures clicked by the phone or issues about not getting the full 13 or 16 megapixels from the camera. The pictures are good enough to get a good print. Although, I must say a little grain is there when pictures clicked in very low light. In medium to low light scenarios, the grains are barely noticeable and will look good in the computer screen. I cast the pictures on my 43 inch 4K TV and it looks good enough. Moreover, everybody uses one or two photo editing apps nowadays and so minor blemishes can easily be fixed. I suggest Google's Snapseed. Another thing I will like to mention to those people who are saying that they are not getting full megapixel effects in their pictures, should know that the phone makers always mention the full megapixel of their cameras subject to one condition. Most people don't know that the full megapixel in pictures can be achieved ONLY in the 4:3 aspect ratio of the pictures. If one clicks pictures with full screen mode, i.e. 16:9, the megapixels WILL always be lower.
  
  11. The phone doesn't show any lag and the app switching is smooth as butter with one left soft key dedicated for the task.
  
  12. The speaker is very good with two speaker grills at the bottom delivering stereo sounds loud enough for the purpose.
  
  13. The charging is efficient and though it doesn't say anywhere of being capable of quick charge, the charging time is decent.
  
  14. There's a power saver mode which is very effective.
  
  15. A lot of themes and fonts are available to customize the phone OS looks.
  
  16. The build quality is good and the back looks premium.
  
  17. I got a factory administered screen guard on the phone which is a little sticky on the front but at least,regular cleaning still makes it clinging to the screen with zero air bubble. Also, a transparent back cover has been provided which till date is just fine.
  
  18. Gesture controls are a draw.
  
  Cons:
  
  1. The absence of app drawer is frustrating. The default icons being on the larger size looks cluttered.
  
  2. The default music player is not good and for that I will suggest a good music player app to be downloaded from GP.
  
  3. Doesn't run Marshmallow. So forget about Nougat for now.
  
  4. The charging adapter unit is bulky.
  
  I suggest to go for this phone.
 
 

   READ MORE

I have used the phone just for 2 weeks and here is my feedback.
  
  Pros
  
  - good build and finish. Light weight
  
  - accessories included like ear phones, scratch guard, decent back cover that is not slippery
  
  - I prefer this size since it is easy for one hand operation
  
  - screen clarity is good both indoor and outdoor
  
  - good response with the 3 GB RAM. I've not installed too many apps though. No issue of hanging so far
  
  - battery life is not bad. I am able to use it for a day and a half with wifi used most of the time. Able to charge from 30% to 100% in around 1 hr
  
  - no heating issue so far
  

  Cons
  
  - can't use the memory slot if you are using dual sim.
  
  - not very happy with ease of using the keypad, especially for dialing from phone book. Have to click twice to dial. Don't know if this is an OS issue
  

  Final comments
  
  Overall great value for money. I would definitely recommend this if your budget is 15 to 20k.

I am using this phone since July 2014. Performance of the phone is good i.e. it doesn't hang while using apps or doesn't get heated even when you talk for 30-40 minutes. However the internal memory is biggest issue. U get only 1 gb internal storage and it gets exhausted very fast and then u cant update important apps. When I spoke to customer care, they said update will be released in Nov and it will resolve the issue but till 6th December, no update is received. So if u want to buy a phone, buy one which has minimum 8 gb ROM or which allows u to save apps on SD card directly. This phone lacks both.

Gr8 looking Awesome phone. I don't know why Oppo or flipkart has not marketed this amazing phone.
  
  I am using the phone since 10 days and really enjoying. Some guys are saying the phone is costly but it is really worth money. Its a premium phone for which you would cost around 30k to 40k for other popular make.
  
  Some say Hybrid 2nd SIM is a problem. You either use 2nd sim or SD card. But 64GB Rom provides you enough space so no need to have SD card.
  

  pros:
  
  Camera: Selfie camera is awesome. I tested the rear camera in low light as well and it is also clicking good photos.
  
  Battery: I liked the fast charging. Within 50 minutes 100% battery get charged. Though its only 2750mh, it last for a day easily with descent working on phone.
  
  Processor & RAM: Fast and smooth operation, never lagged so far.
  
  Color OS: Very refreshing. Got 2 updates in 10 days period.
  
  Ultra slim: I opted this phone mainly for its thinness. Its light and just 6.6mm thin.
  
  Warranty: 2 years. no one provides 2 years warranty.
  
  64 GB ROM: Another reason i purchase this phone for. Really fade up of old phone of having only 8GB internal memory.
  
  The phone does not come with too much freeloaded APPs.  That is big relief as you need root the phone to uninstall the bulky apps.
  


  Cons:
  
  1. Specs mentions displays has corning gorilla glass 4, but i doubt as my phone has got scratches. Putting the scratch guard on.
  

  So guys if you have 26K budget, go grab this phone without any doubt.

I'll mention here good and bad points about this phone and I'll give my conclusion
  

  Good
  
  Very good build quality
  
  Vibrant display with good sunlight legibility
  
  Good battery life
  
  Cameras fare well in daylight
  
  Fast charging
  

  Bad
  
  No Wi-Fi ac or NFC
  
  Weak low-light camera performance
  
  Hybrid SIM slot
  

  Pointwise
  

  Design 8 points
  
  Display 7 points
  
  Software 7 points
  
  Performance 8 points
  
  Battery life 8 points
  
  Camera 8 points
  
  Value for money 7 points
  
  Overall I'll give 7 points to this device
  

  Here's my conclusion
  

  Oppo has created yet another good-looking smartphone with the F1 Plus. Yes, the new hardware and software look very much like Apple's iPhone and iOS, but that's not necessarily a bad thing. There are people out there who would love to own an iPhone but don't have the means to do so, and it's smartphones like this that help fill the void. At Rs. 26,990 the F1 Plus is certainly a lot more affordable than an iPhone 6 as well.
  

  That resemblance aside, the F1 Plus is beautifully crafted and extremely well built. It's slim and light weight, has a super-fast fingerprint sensor, vibrant display, good battery life and two very good cameras for daylight photography. Like any tech product however, there's always room for improvement. For instance, the screen's viewing angles aren't the best, and it takes on a bluish tinge if you veer too far from the sweet spot. We would also have liked better connectivity features too such as NFC and Wi-Fi ac. Also, despite the large 16-megapixel selfie camera, it doesn't fare terribly well in low-light situations. The screen flash is nice touch but it's no substitute for an LED flash, especially if you're taking a group selfie.
  

  Overall, the F1 Plus is good smartphone that would be even better at a lower price considering its limitations.

  I would still say it's a best phone in market! Thanks to oppo!

Hi , dis is Subha. I m from kolkata..
  
  After using oppo f1 plus (rose gold) for 7 months i m writing dis review... I hav bought dis phn from a local store. Bt i dont know wht to say, actually i m speechless... Honestly speaking dis phone was not my 1st choice at that time bt now i cant think abt anything bt this...
  
  Okk... Lets start with it.....
  

  PROS------......
  

  1. Battary backup is superb, normaly i spend 5hrs on dis phn daily playing some heavy games like fifa16, NFS most wanted. And also do some vdo calling... And while taking voice call i always surf net or play games.. Bt still i just have to charge dis phn only once in a day.
  

  2. 4gb RAM is really fast... Nothing to say abt it.. In this 7months my phn never hanged not even once.. And u knw how heavily i use dis phn.
  

  3. Camera... Rear 13mp really good. Better than htc , samsung , apple and VIVO...
  
  Front 16mp, man nothing to say abt it. I hav sold my digi cam after seeing this camera. Just 2words Crystal Clear...
  

  4. Design- honestly speaking if u hold dis phn u will feel like u r holding i-phone 7... So slick. So sexy...
  

  5. Display is also good.. Its amoled.
  

  6. Sound- Smooth, clear. Headphone quality is also good.
  

  7. Others- fingerprint sensor is superb, it also has vox charger means from 20% -100% in less than 30 mins. Storage is 64gb so no need for sd card. It has gorrila glass4 so do some rough use it doesnt matter...
  

  CONS-----.....
  

  1. Sorry sorry sorry...
  
  In 7 months i didnt find any..... If i found anythng i will let u knw... Bt for that i bliv i hat to wait for 2-3years may b or more...

I have used the phone just for 2 weeks and here is my feedback.
  
  Pros
  
  - good build and finish. Light weight
  
  - accessories included like ear phones, scratch guard, decent back cover that is not slippery
  
  - I prefer this size since it is easy for one hand operation
  
  - screen clarity is good both indoor and outdoor
  
  - good response with the 3 GB RAM. I've not installed too many apps though. No issue of hanging so far
  
  - battery life is not bad. I am able to use it for a day and a half with wifi used most of the time. Able to charge from 30% to 100% in around 1 hr
  
  - no heating issue so far
  

  Cons
  
  - can't use the memory slot if you are using dual sim.
  
  - not very happy with ease of using the keypad, especially for dialing from phone book. Have to click twice to dial. Don't know if this is an OS issue
  

  Final comments
  
  Overall great value for money. I would definitely recommend this if your budget is 15 to 20k.

column6: AMAZING PHONE WITH AMAZING FEATURES.... IN SOME BANKRUPT AFRICAN COUNTRY!!
column7:
Dear All,
  

  Please don't blame OPPO as a brand to market this product in India, they are just doing their Job. It's not really your fault, if you'll would've known the story behind this model from Oppo you'll would've symphathized with the Company and Bought it.
  

  The Real Story was the OPPO Engineers put together days and nights and they went to every electronic dumping station and recovered all the long thrown away pieces of the 2008's and 2009's.
  

  They then handpicked each piece and consereved it. The refurbished each piece and re-branded it and made all of its amazing features work, like a 3.0 Megapixel Camera or a 512MB RAM. Some of the engineer's were so dedicated that they even contributed to giving away a part of thier phone's RAM into some 2008 256 RAM Models. With additional Features such as a Basic 480 X 800 pixel 4-inch screen and 4GB internal storage their mission was accomplished to make the Ultimate phone for a Plague Stricken and Bankrupt Country in Africa.
  

  They knew that the poverty and backwardness in those country's hasn't attracted to many Global Giants of Technology. They were also sure that since the Countries in Africa are at least 50 years behind the rest, they could easily sell a product of the 2008's - 2009's. This was their Eureka Moment. So they set out to be the Great Pioneer's of Cell Phones in Africa, just like how Nokia once was to India, OPPO would be to Africa!! With this endeavoring mission they started packing and shipping their lot of OPPO Joy R1001.
  

  So when the Shipment of the handsets was on its way, the company was informed of the notorious Ebola Virus which was spreading like wildfire. Hence to ensure the safety of their employees, they halted their ship at the nearest port, in India. So days passed and their stock was ready but not sold. The company started going into losses, that's when the head honcho's at OPPO panicked.
  

  In the mean time one of their employee, who was exploring the port city of Mumbai happened to roam at Kharghar, in Navi Mumbai. There he noticed that there was a niche market for their product to Nigerians and Other People from the African country who resided there as Students. The employee then thought of an Idea which would tarnish OPPO's image in India forever. He decided to requested the OPPO heads to allow him to utilize this OPPOrtunity and start advertising and selling these Phones in Mumbai.
  

  And since then The Employee has never looked Back.... Cause HE WAS FIRED!!
 
 

   READ MORE

Gr8 looking Awesome phone. I don't know why Oppo or flipkart has not marketed this amazing phone.
  
  I am using the phone since 10 days and really enjoying. Some guys are saying the phone is costly but it is really worth money. Its a premium phone for which you would cost around 30k to 40k for other popular make.
  
  Some say Hybrid 2nd SIM is a problem. You either use 2nd sim or SD card. But 64GB Rom provides you enough space so no need to have SD card.
  

  pros:
  
  Camera: Selfie camera is awesome. I tested the rear camera in low light as well and it is also clicking good photos.
  
  Battery: I liked the fast charging. Within 50 minutes 100% battery get charged. Though its only 2750mh, it last for a day easily with descent working on phone.
  
  Processor & RAM: Fast and smooth operation, never lagged so far.
  
  Color OS: Very refreshing. Got 2 updates in 10 days period.
  
  Ultra slim: I opted this phone mainly for its thinness. Its light and just 6.6mm thin.
  
  Warranty: 2 years. no one provides 2 years warranty.
  
  64 GB ROM: Another reason i purchase this phone for. Really fade up of old phone of having only 8GB internal memory.
  
  The phone does not come with too much freeloaded APPs.  That is big relief as you need root the phone to uninstall the bulky apps.
  


  Cons:
  
  1. Specs mentions displays has corning gorilla glass 4, but i doubt as my phone has got scratches. Putting the scratch guard on.
  

  So guys if you have 26K budget, go grab this phone without any doubt.

I'll mention here good and bad points about this phone and I'll give my conclusion
  

  Good
  
  Very good build quality
  
  Vibrant display with good sunlight legibility
  
  Good battery life
  
  Cameras fare well in daylight
  
  Fast charging
  

  Bad
  
  No Wi-Fi ac or NFC
  
  Weak low-light camera performance
  
  Hybrid SIM slot
  

  Pointwise
  

  Design 8 points
  
  Display 7 points
  
  Software 7 points
  
  Performance 8 points
  
  Battery life 8 points
  
  Camera 8 points
  
  Value for money 7 points
  
  Overall I'll give 7 points to this device
  

  Here's my conclusion
  

  Oppo has created yet another good-looking smartphone with the F1 Plus. Yes, the new hardware and software look very much like Apple's iPhone and iOS, but that's not necessarily a bad thing. There are people out there who would love to own an iPhone but don't have the means to do so, and it's smartphones like this that help fill the void. At Rs. 26,990 the F1 Plus is certainly a lot more affordable than an iPhone 6 as well.
  

  That resemblance aside, the F1 Plus is beautifully crafted and extremely well built. It's slim and light weight, has a super-fast fingerprint sensor, vibrant display, good battery life and two very good cameras for daylight photography. Like any tech product however, there's always room for improvement. For instance, the screen's viewing angles aren't the best, and it takes on a bluish tinge if you veer too far from the sweet spot. We would also have liked better connectivity features too such as NFC and Wi-Fi ac. Also, despite the large 16-megapixel selfie camera, it doesn't fare terribly well in low-light situations. The screen flash is nice touch but it's no substitute for an LED flash, especially if you're taking a group selfie.
  

  Overall, the F1 Plus is good smartphone that would be even better at a lower price considering its limitations.

Hi , dis is Subha. I m from kolkata..
  
  After using oppo f1 plus (rose gold) for 7 months i m writing dis review... I hav bought dis phn from a local store. Bt i dont know wht to say, actually i m speechless... Honestly speaking dis phone was not my 1st choice at that time bt now i cant think abt anything bt this...
  
  Okk... Lets start with it.....
  

  PROS------......
  

  1. Battary backup is superb, normaly i spend 5hrs on dis phn daily playing some heavy games like fifa16, NFS most wanted. And also do some vdo calling... And while taking voice call i always surf net or play games.. Bt still i just have to charge dis phn only once in a day.
  

  2. 4gb RAM is really fast... Nothing to say abt it.. In this 7months my phn never hanged not even once.. And u knw how heavily i use dis phn.
  

  3. Camera... Rear 13mp really good. Better than htc , samsung , apple and VIVO...
  
  Front 16mp, man nothing to say abt it. I hav sold my digi cam after seeing this camera. Just 2words Crystal Clear...
  

  4. Design- honestly speaking if u hold dis phn u will feel like u r holding i-phone 7... So slick. So sexy...
  

  5. Display is also good.. Its amoled.
  

  6. Sound- Smooth, clear. Headphone quality is also good.
  

  7. Others- fingerprint sensor is superb, it also has vox charger means from 20% -100% in less than 30 mins. Storage is 64gb so no need for sd card. It has gorrila glass4 so do some rough use it doesnt matter...
  

  CONS-----.....
  

  1. Sorry sorry sorry...
  
  In 7 months i didnt find any..... If i found anythng i will let u knw... Bt for that i bliv i hat to wait for 2-3years may b or more...

column6: Give it a try!You wait a surprise!!
column7:
This is a review after using the phone for 3 months.
  

  I have used Iphone 6,Lenovo vibe shot,Lumia 820,Samsung galaxy note edge and by far its way better a phone than these.Oppo lacks in promotional policies,and web designing is pathetic for them,with a chinese tag attached to it,makes people hard to believe what it is worthy of.Brilliant fingerprint recognisation,amazing fast charging(It charges 2-3% in every single minute),huge 4 GB RAM,wonderful maltitasking with no gaming lag,good speakers(I won't say brilliant,but it's good),absolute zero heating issues and last but not least awesome,and I mean awesome, network adaptability.
  

  Yes,price is a bit at high end,this device priced at 20000/- would be a steal deal,yet,I definitely would suggest to give it a try.You wait a surprise!

column6: Very good product at good price
column7:
I am using this mobile since around two weeks. My opinion about the phone is:
  

  Pros:
  
  1. The builds quality seems to be very good.
  

  2. I was earlier using galaxy S4. The battery backup is better than S4.
  

  3. The display of mobile is stunning.
  

  4. Call quality and network reception are very good.
  

  5. The internet performance is much better than galaxy S4,  I was earlier using.
  

  6. Battery charging is extremely fast (the feature I like the most).
  

  7. The speakers are really loud.
  

  8. As far as specs are concerned, the only competitor is Lg G3 (priced at whopping 48000/-).
  

  9. My Antutu benchmark score is 42999, next to only HTC M8. Galaxy S5, Lg G3 are all behind it.
  

  10. Color OS is very stable and UI looks better than that of samsung Touchwiz ui.
  

  Cons:
  
  1. The price is bit high ( But seems reasonable with these specs).
  

  2. There is some play (gap w.r.t. body) in physical buttons I.e. power and volume buttons. The samsung devices physical buttons have nearly zero play.
  

  3. No service centres.
  

  4. Camera is good but not best.
  

  5. Android version is 4.3.
  

  6. Official accessories are not available.
 
 

   READ MORE
